head.supplied: Melbourne, botan. Garden, ¶ 18 Nov. 1864. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to place the sum of eight shillings and six pences ¶ under authority from the vote of travel...

div.p: K64/11823, unit 35, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to place the sum of eight shillings and six pences
MS marginal annotation: '£—8/6'. under authority from the vote of travelling expenses granted to this establishment, to liquidate the remaining claims against that vote for this year; and further I beg to solicit that the balance then available out of that vote, vize £9—11/6d (nine pounds eleven shillings six pences sterling) may be transferred to the vote of incidental expenses.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,
